Text.Value: They like feastin', fightin', and fornicatin'. Who doesn't? Absolute gives 'em that.
Cuz I'm loyal to Maglubiyet! Cuz I ain't havin' my 'ed turned by some upstart god!
Yeah. My whole tribe's fallen for this shite. Traitorous bastards.
So bollocks to you and bollocks to Her an' all.

EditorData.NodeContext: disgusted with us - 'Her' refers to a goddess he hates

Text.Value: My goddess is real. I follow Lolth, the Spider Queen.
Good on ya - don't matter to me if it's Shar, Gond, or my boy Maglubiyet; it's about tradition.

EditorData.NodeContext: Shar, Gond and ma-GLUB-i-yet are gods. He likes these old gods

Text.Value: They've all gone barmy - 'ad their 'eds turned from the old ways by some upstart god!
If you 'ad 'alf a brain, you wouldn't be muckin' around in 'ere at all.
They'll turn on you soon enuff... then you'll be wishin' you woz in a cage.
The Absolute? The other goblins seem to love Her.
Maybe your people can build a nice little necropolis on the carcass of this Absolute joker.

EditorData.NodeContext: Sarcastic - the 'Absolute' is a goddess and we just said our people built cities on the caracasses of gods

Text.Value: *You know Maglubiyet - a tyrannical deity who treats his goblinoid followers as slaves.*

EditorData.NodeContext: internal monologue - ma-GLUB-i-yet is a god, just mentioned in the dialog

Text.Value: Gotta know yer place in the world though. Maglubiyet kept us in line. Tha's wot a god's s'posed to do.

EditorData.NodeContext: proud of the point he's making -  ma-GLUB-i-yet is his god

Text.Value: Bollocks to yer Absolute and bollocks to you an' all.
I hope they throttle you with yer beard. Now piss off!
Leave.
Reveal your brand with a smile.
Gormless? I'm not the one behind bars.
Yeah. And I can see by that mark on yer 'and that you're part of Her mob.

EditorData.NodeContext: disgusted with us - 'Her' refers to a goddess he hates

Text.Value: The great Absolute brings us together. Drow and gnolls and goblins, all braidin' one another's hair.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Pretending to pray and worship the sky
EditorData.NodeContext: He's mimicking zealous goblins, using a whiney voice

Text.Value: But sod 'em all. I'll wait it out in 'ere, prayin' to a real god.
Gods are fickle. Maglubiyet doesn't give a damn about you.
Maglubiyet's looked out for me since I was knee-high to a worg-pup.

EditorData.NodeContext: ma-GLUB-i-yet is his god, sincerely proud of his god

Text.Value: Oh, that's rich! A free world? Then how come I'm locked up like a bloody elf? I'll tell ya why...
I find all of Faern's gods rather tiresome.
My people build cities on the corpses of gods. Yours does not impress me.
Are you soft in the 'ed? Every bleeder in 'ere is gabbin' on about it. Traitorous bastards.
Could tell you were as barmy as the rest of 'em as soon as I clapped eyes on ya.
You think this is funny? I'll be the one laughin' when things turn ugly. Safer in 'ere than out there.

EditorData.NodeContext: sneering, angry, locked in a cage

Text.Value: Yeah. And I can see by that mark on yer hand that you're part of Her mob.
You don't like your people mixing with outsiders?
My whole tribe's fallen for this shite. Traitorous bastards.
And why did they turn on you?
It's a load of shite!
Bollocks to this Absolute, I say. And bollocks to you an' all.
Spiders and worgs are nothing. I can handle myself.
My god is very real.
Talkin' to you ain't I? I just don't believe in all this togetherness an' chumminess. Ain't natural.
I assume you mean the Absolute?
And who is this 'upstart god'?
You'll end up bein' supper for the spiders or the worgs.
Tryin' to interrupt my prayers? Scared of a real god? You're as gormless as the rest of 'em.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: He turns his attention to the player
EditorData.NodeContext: Sneering, aggressive, but locked in a cage

Text.Value: *You know Maglubiyet - deity of the goblinoids, hungry for blood and conquest.*
I'd gladly let a goblin braid my beard.
It won't last. They'll be tearin' into each other soon enough.

EditorData.NodeContext: irritated, but amused his enemies are going to get a reckoning

Text.Value: This upstart everyone's praisin' is gonna trample all over our gods and our faith... makes me sick.
Good on ya - don't matter to me if it's Lolth or my boy Maglubiyet; it's about tradition.

EditorData.NodeContext: Lolth is our goddess, ma-GLUB-i-yet is his god; he's emphasising the importance of faith

Text.Value: Pray to whoever you want. It's a free world.
Maglubiyet's a tyrant. Your people are better off without him.
Praise his ever-bleedin' axe, praise his throne of flamin' iron. Praise Maglubiyet!

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: He's speaking to his god, staring up
EditorData.NodeContext: Chanting a prayer fiercely - ma-GLUB-i-yet is the name of his god

Text.Value: How'd you land yourself in that cage?
Seems to be working out pretty well for them, actually.

Synopsis: A goblin who still follows the old goblin god, Maglubiyet, while the rest of his tribe have started to follow a new god, the Absolute. He sees them as heretics - they think the same of him, and have locked him in a cage.
